alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:46PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Jackson, northwestern Gadsden, southwestern Decatur and southeastern Seminole Counties through 415 PM EDT/315 PM CDT/... At 346 PM EDT/246 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chattahoochee, or 18 miles southwest of Bainbridge, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chattahoochee, Sneads, Seminole State Park, Desser, Reynoldsville, Hardin Heights, Rosedale, Recovery, Drakes Still, Jinks, Fairchild, River Junction and Lake Seminole. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
